intro: Alkanna galilaea, commonly known as the Palestine alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Alkanna galilaea is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
